elements.name: The test server is idle and awaits connections

steps.name: the test server is ready
the server has 0 active connections

elements.name: The client is instantiated and creates a connection

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server has 1 active connections
the clients connection state is "AWAITING_CONNECTION"

name: Connecting a client
description:
As soon as the client is instantiated
	it establishes a connection to the
	server and awaits login

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised with a small heartbeat interval
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the server sends the message C|PI+
the server received the message C|PO+
two seconds later
the client throws a "connectionError" error with message "heartbeat not received in the last 1000 milliseconds"

name: Heartbeats
description:
Heartbeats are deepstreams way of knowing a server
    hasn't gone down unexpectedly.

elements.name: Redirecting the client to another deepstream gets rejected

steps.name: the test server is ready
the second test server is ready
the second server has 0 active connections
the client is initialised
the server has 1 active connections
the clients connection state is "AWAITING_CONNECTION"
the server sends the message C|CH+
the last message the server recieved is C|CHR|<FIRST_SERVER_URL>+
the clients connection state is "CHALLENGING"
the server sends the message C|REJ+
the server has 0 active connections
the clients connection state is "CLOSED"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server has received 1 messages
the client throws a "IS_CLOSED" error with message "this client's connection was closed"

name: Redirecting the client to another deepstream gets rejected
description:
If the client fails the connection challenge it should then close the connection
	and not allow authentication to occur

elements.name: Redirecting a client to another deepstream

steps.name: the test server is ready
the second test server is ready
the second server has 0 active connections
the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server has 1 active connections
the clients connection state is "AWAITING_CONNECTION"
the server sends the message C|CH+
the last message the server recieved is C|CHR|<FIRST_SERVER_URL>+
the clients connection state is "CHALLENGING"
the server sends the message C|RED|<SECOND_SERVER_URL>+
the server has 0 active connections
some time passes
the server has 0 active connections
the client is on the second server
the second server has 1 active connections
the clients connection state is "AWAITING_CONNECTION"
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the last message the server recieved is A|REQ|{"username":"XXX","password":"YYY"}+
the clients connection state is "AUTHENTICATING"
the server sends the message A|A+
the clients connection state is "OPEN"
the last login was successful

name: Redirecting a client to another deepstream
description:
The client should be able to recieve a connection redirect
	to allow it to connect to a seperate deepstream url if needed

elements.name: The client logs in with valid authentication credentials

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the last message the server recieved is A|REQ|{"username":"XXX","password":"YYY"}+
the clients connection state is "AUTHENTICATING"
the server sends the message A|A+
the clients connection state is "OPEN"
the last login was successful

elements.name: The client logs in with invalid credentials

steps.name: the client is initialised
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|E|INVALID_AUTH_DATA|Sinvalid authentication data+
the last login failed with error message "invalid authentication data"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "ZZZ"
the server sends the message A|E|INVALID_AUTH_DATA|Sinvalid authentication data+
the last login failed with error message "invalid authentication data"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "ZZZ"
the server sends the message A|E|TOO_MANY_AUTH_ATTEMPTS|Stoo many authentication attempts+
the last login failed with error message "too many authentication attempts"

name: Logging In
description:
As soon as the client is initialised, it creates a connection with
	the server. However the connection is initially in a quarantine
	state until it sends an authentication message. The auth message
	(A|REQ|<JSON authData>) must always be the first message send by
	the client.

elements.name: The client attempts to subscribe to the same event multiple times
elements.description:
only triggers a single subscribe message to the server and the
	incoming events should be multiplexed on the client

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the server resets its message count
the client subscribes to an event named "test2"
the server sends the message E|A|S|test2+
the client subscribes to an event named "test2"
the server received the message E|S|test2+
the server has received 1 messages

name: Events Misc
description:
This feature covers other possible scenarios that can occur, such as
	attempting to unsubscribe to an event that you haven't subscribed to.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client subscribes to an event named "test1"
the last message the server recieved is E|S|test1+
the server sends the message E|A|S|test1+
the client listens to events matching "eventPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is E|L|eventPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message E|A|L|eventPrefix/.*+
the connection to the server is lost
two seconds later
the client throws a "connectionError" error with message "Can't connect! Deepstream server unreachable on ws://localhost:7777/deepstream"
the clients connection state is "RECONNECTING"
the client publishes an event named "test1" with data "yetAnotherValue"
the server did not recieve any messages
the connection to the server is reestablished
the server sends the message C|A+
the clients connection state is "AUTHENTICATING"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the clients connection state is "OPEN"
the server received the message E|S|test1+
the server received the message E|L|eventPrefix/.*+
the server received the message E|EVT|test1|SyetAnotherValue+

name: Events Connectivity
description:
Events subscriptions must be resent to the
	server after connection issues to guarantee
	it continues recieving them correctly.

	This applies to both subscribing to events
	and listening to event subscriptions.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client listens to events matching "eventPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is E|L|eventPrefix/.*+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for eventPrefix/.*"
the client unlistens to events matching "eventPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is E|UL|eventPrefix/.*+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for eventPrefix/.*"

name: Event Listen Timeouts
description:
Whenever a listen subscribe or unsubscribe
	event does not receive an acknowledgement from
	the server the client should emit an ack
	timeout error so that the client can attempt
	to retry.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client listens to events matching "eventPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is E|L|eventPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message E|A|L|eventPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message E|SP|eventPrefix/.*|eventPrefix/foundAMatch+
the client will be notified of new event match "eventPrefix/foundAMatch"
the server sends the message E|SR|eventPrefix/.*|eventPrefix/foundAMatch+
the client will be notified of event match removal "eventPrefix/foundAMatch"
the client unlistens to events matching "eventPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is E|UL|eventPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message E|A|UL|eventPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message E|SP|eventPrefix/.*|eventPrefix/foundAMatch+
the client throws a "UNSOLICITED_MESSAGE" error with message "eventPrefix/.*"

name: Event Listen
description:
Listening to Event subscriptions/unsubscriptions
	allows the client to reduce the events it
	needs to publish. If a client subscribes to
	an event that matches your pattern or when all
	the clients unsubscribe you'll be told so you
	can only publish events that you know are
	being listened to.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client subscribes to an event named "test1"
the server received the message E|S|test1+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for test1"
the client unsubscribes from an event named "test1"
the server received the message E|US|test1+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for test1"

name: Events Timeouts
description:
Whenever a subscribe or unsubscribe event does
	not recieve an acknolowdgement from the server
	the client should emit an ack timeout error so
	that the client can attempt to retry.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client subscribes to an event named "test1"
the server received the message E|S|test1+
the server sends the message E|A|S|test1+
the server sends the message E|EVT|test1|SsomeValue+
the client received the event "test1" with data "someValue"
the server sends the message E|EVT|test1|SanotherValue+
the client received the event "test1" with data "anotherValue"
the client publishes an event named "test1" with data "yetAnotherValue"
the server received the message E|EVT|test1|SyetAnotherValue+
the client unsubscribes from an event named "test1"
the server received the message E|US|test1+
the server sends the message E|A|US|test1+

name: Events
description:
Events are deepstream's publish-subscribe
	pattern. Everytime a client subscribes to or
	unsubscribes from an event the server replies
	with an acknowledgment message

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client subscribes to presence events for "userA,userB"
the server received the message U|S|1|["userA","userB"]+
the server sends the message U|A|S|1+
the client subscribes to all presence events
the server received the message U|S|S+
the server sends the message U|A|S|S+
the connection to the server is lost
two seconds later
the client throws a "connectionError" error with message "Can't connect! Deepstream server unreachable on ws://localhost:7777/deepstream"
the clients connection state is "RECONNECTING"
the client queries for connected clients
the server did not recieve any messages
the client queries if "userA,userB" are online
the server did not recieve any messages
the connection to the server is reestablished
the server sends the message C|A+
the clients connection state is "AUTHENTICATING"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the clients connection state is "OPEN"
the server received the message U|S|3|["userA","userB"]+
the server received the message U|S|S+
the server received the message U|Q|Q+
the server received the message U|Q|2|["userA","userB"]+

name: Presence Connectivity
description:
Presence subscription must be sent to the server.
    after connection issues to guarantee
	it continues recieving them correctly.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client queries for connected clients
the server received the message U|Q|Q+
the server sends the message U|Q+
the client is notified that no clients are connected
the client queries for connected clients
the server received the message U|Q|Q+
the server sends the message U|Q|Homer|Marge|Bart+
the client is notified that clients "Homer,Marge,Bart" are connected
the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client queries if "userA,userB" are online
the server received the message U|Q|1|["userA","userB"]+
the server sends the message U|Q|1|{"userA": false, "userB": true}+
the client is notified with '{"userA": false, "userB": true}'

name: Presence
description:
Presence is deepstreams way of querying for clients
	and knowing about client login/logout events

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client subscribes to all presence events
the server received the message U|S|S+
the server sends the message U|A|S|S+
the server sends the message U|PNJ|userA+
the client is notified that client "userA" logged in
the server sends the message U|PNL|userA+
the client is notified that client "userA" logged out
the client unsubscribes to all presence events
the server received the message U|US|US+
the server sends the message U|A|US|US+
the server sends the message U|PNJ|userA+
the client is not notified that client "userA" logged in

name: Presence
description:
Presence is deepstreams way of querying for clients
    and knowing about client login/logout events

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client subscribes to presence events for "userA,userB"
the server received the message U|S|1|["userA","userB"]+
the server sends the message U|A|S|1+
the server sends the message U|PNJ|userA+
the client is notified that client "userA" logged in
the server sends the message U|PNL|userB+
the client is notified that client "userB" logged out
the client unsubscribes to presence events for "userA"
the server received the message U|US|2|["userA"]+
the server sends the message U|A|US|2+
the server sends the message U|PNJ|userB+
the client is notified that client "userB" logged in
the server sends the message U|PNJ|userA+
the client is not notified that client "userA" logged in

name: Presence
description:
Presence is deepstreams way of querying for clients
    and knowing about client login/logout events

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client subscribes to all presence events
the server received the message U|S|S+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for S"
the client unsubscribes to all presence events
the server received the message U|US|US+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for US"

name: Presence Timeouts
description:
Whenever a subscribe or unsubscribe event does
	not recieve an acknowledgement from the server
	the client should emit an ack timeout error so
	that the client can attempt to retry.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client creates a record named "mergeRecord"
the server sends the message R|A|S|mergeRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|mergeRecord|100|{"key":"value1"}+
the client sets the record "mergeRecord" "key" to "value3"
the server sends the message R|E|VERSION_EXISTS|mergeRecord|101|{"key":"value2"}+
the last message the server recieved is R|P|mergeRecord|101|key|Svalue3+
the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client creates a record named "mergeRecord"
the server sends the message R|A|S|mergeRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|mergeRecord|100|{"key":"value1"}+
the server sends the message R|U|mergeRecord|100|{"key":"value3"}+
the last message the server recieved is R|CR|mergeRecord+

name: Record Conflicts
description:
Record conflicts occur most often when the
	client disconnects, does offline work and then
	reconnects resulting in a merge issue with
	other potential edits, but can also occur in
	rare conditions as part of a race condition.

	If a conflict does occur, the client should
	recieve a VERSION_EXISTS error.

	These tests do not send anything back to the
	server because by default record conflicts
	are REMOTE_WINS, meaning they accepts the
	server data

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client creates a record named "connectionRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|CR|connectionRecord+
the server sends the message R|A|S|connectionRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|connectionRecord|100|{"name":"John", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffles", "type":"dog","age":2}]}+
the client listens to a record matching "recordPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is R|L|recordPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message R|A|L|recordPrefix/.*+
the connection to the server is lost
two seconds later
the client throws a "connectionError" error with message "Can't connect! Deepstream server unreachable on ws://localhost:7777/deepstream"
the clients connection state is "RECONNECTING"
the client sets the record "connectionRecord" "pets.0.name" to "Max"
the connection to the server is reestablished
the server sends the message C|A+
the clients connection state is "AUTHENTICATING"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the clients connection state is "OPEN"
the server received the message R|CR|connectionRecord+
the server received the message R|L|recordPrefix/.*+
the server received the message R|P|connectionRecord|101|pets.0.name|SMax+

name: Record Connectivity
description:
Record connectivity is slightly more
	complicated than the other types. We must
	resubscribe listen patterns, however the when
	rerequesting the read action to resubscribe to
	records the result from the server must be
	executed as an update rather than an initial
	read.

	This is because possible merge conflicts may
	occur if versions are not in sync while the
	connection was lost.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client checks if the server has the record "existingRecord"
the server sends the message R|H|existingRecord|T|+
the client is told the record "existingRecord" exists
the client checks if the server has the record "nonExistentRecord"
the server sends the message R|H|nonExistentRecord|F|+
the client is told the record "nonExistentRecord" doesn't exist
the client creates a record named "hasRecord"
the server sends the message R|A|S|hasRecord+
the client checks if the server has the record "hasRecord"
the server didn't receive the message R|H|hasRecord+
the client is told the record "existingRecord" exists

name: Record Has
description:
Record Has allows you to query whether or not a record 
    exists.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client listens to a record matching "recordPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is R|L|recordPrefix/.*+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for recordPrefix/.*"
the client unlistens to a record matching "recordPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is R|UL|recordPrefix/.*+

name: Record Listen Timeouts
description:
Whenever a listen subscribe or unsubscribe
	event does not recieve an acknolowdgement from
	the server the client should emit an ack
	timeout error so that the client can attempt
	to retry.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client listens to a record matching "recordPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is R|L|recordPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message R|A|L|recordPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message R|SP|recordPrefix/.*|recordPrefix/foundAMatch+
the client will be notified of new record match "recordPrefix/foundAMatch"
the server sends the message R|SR|recordPrefix/.*|recordPrefix/foundAMatch+
the client will be notified of record match removal "recordPrefix/foundAMatch"
the client unlistens to a record matching "recordPrefix/.*"
the last message the server recieved is R|UL|recordPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message R|A|UL|recordPrefix/.*+
the server sends the message R|SP|recordPrefix/.*|recordPrefix/foundAMatch+
the client throws a "UNSOLICITED_MESSAGE" error with message "recordPrefix/.*"

name: Record Listen
description:
Listening to Record usage allows the client to
	reduce the amount of records it needs to
	update. If a client requests a record that
	matches your pattern or when all the clients
	discard it you'll be told so you can only need
	to update records that you know are being
	listened used.

	This helps reduce the amount of updates you
	have in the system at any time. Please note,
	when using records to update values within
	the deepstream database which is also queried
	you will need to ensure those records are
	requested for the query to work with the
	latest data, or avoid using listen for those
	records.

elements.name: Requesting record multiple times
elements.description:
The client attempts to request the same record
	multiple times. This should still only trigger
	a single subscribe message to the server and
	the incoming events should be multiplexed on
	the client

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the server resets its message count
the client creates a record named "doubleRecord"
the server sends the message R|A|S|doubleRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|doubleRecord|100|{"name":"John", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffles", "type":"dog","age":2}]}+
the client creates a record named "doubleRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|CR|doubleRecord+
the server has received 1 messages

name: Record Misc
description:
This feature covers other possible scenarios that can occur, such
	as the client requesting the same record multiple times.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client creates a record named "snapshotRecord"
the server sends the message R|A|S|snapshotRecord+
the client requests a snapshot for the record "snapshotRecord"
the client has no response for the snapshot of record "snapshotRecord"
the server sends the message R|E|SN|snapshotRecord|RECORD_NOT_FOUND+
the client is told the record "snapshotRecord" encountered an error retrieving snapshot
the client requests a snapshot for the record "snapshotRecord"
the client has no response for the snapshot of record "snapshotRecord"
the server sends the message R|R|snapshotRecord|100|{"name":"John"}+
the client is provided the snapshot for record "snapshotRecord" with data "{"name":"John"}"

name: Record Snapshot
description:
Record Snapshot allows you to request for the record data,
	and is useful to use if you only want to load a record data
	without subscribing. If the record doesn't exist an error
	if provided.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client creates a record named "subscribeRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|CR|subscribeRecord+
the server sends the message R|A|S|subscribeRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|subscribeRecord|124|{"name":"Smith","pets":[{"name":"Ruffus","type":"dog","age":0}]}+
the client subscribes to the entire record "subscribeRecord" changes
the client will not be notified of the record change
the server sends the message R|U|subscribeRecord|125|{"name":"Smith","pets":[{"name":"Ruffus","type":"dog","age":1}]}+
the client will be notified of the record change
the server sends the message R|P|subscribeRecord|126|pets.0.name|SRuffusTheSecond+
the client will be notified of the partial record change
the client unsubscribes to the entire record "subscribeRecord" changes
the server sends the message R|U|subscribeRecord|127|{"name":"Smith","pets":[{"name":"Ruffus","type":"dog","age":1}]}+
the client will not be notified of the record change
the client subscribes to "pets.0.age" for the record "subscribeRecord"
the client will not be notified of the record change
the server sends the message R|P|subscribeRecord|128|name|SJohn Smith+
the client will not be notified of the record change
the server sends the message R|U|subscribeRecord|129|{"name":"John Smith", "age": 21, "pets": [{"name":"Ruffus", "type":"dog","age":1}]}+
the client will not be notified of the record change
the server sends the message R|P|subscribeRecord|130|pets.0.age|N4+
the client will be notified of the record change
the server sends the message R|U|subscribeRecord|131|{"name":"John Smith", "age": 21, "pets": [{"name":"Ruffus", "type":"dog","age":5}]}+
the client will be notified of the second record change
the client unsubscribes to "pets.0.age" for the record "subscribeRecord"
the server sends the message R|P|subscribeRecord|132|pets.0.age|N6+
the client will not be notified of the record change

name: Record Subscription
description:
Record subscriptions is done purely on the
	client side. Whenever an update is recieved
	for a record, you should find out if anyone is
	interested and then notify them. When
	implementing, please keep in mind the
	difference between an update and a patch.

	Updates mean you should fully discard the data
	that you had, and replace it with the data
	recieved.

	Patch means you should apply the diff onto the
	data you currently have.

	From the clients callback perspective there
	isn't really a difference when recieving
	updates or patches, since the new data is
	compared against the old and only the
	differences are provided to the callback

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client creates a record named "unhappyRecord"
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for unhappyRecord"
the server sends the message R|A|S|unhappyRecord+
some time passes
the client throws a "RESPONSE_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for unhappyRecord"
the server sends the message R|R|unhappyRecord|100|{"reasons":["Because."]}+
the client sets the record "unhappyRecord" to {"reasons":["Just Because."]}
the last message the server recieved is R|U|unhappyRecord|101|{"reasons":["Just Because."]}+
the server sends the message R|E|CACHE_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT|unhappyRecord+
the client throws a "CACHE_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT" error with message "unhappyRecord"
the server sends the message R|E|STORAGE_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT|unhappyRecord+
the client throws a "STORAGE_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT" error with message "unhappyRecord"
the client discards the record named "unhappyRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|US|unhappyRecord+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for unhappyRecord"
the client creates a record named "unhappyRecord"
the server sends the message R|A|S|unhappyRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|unhappyRecord|100|{"reasons":["Because."]}+
the client deletes the record named "unhappyRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|D|unhappyRecord+
some time passes
the client throws a "DELETE_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for unhappyRecord"

name: Record Timeouts
description:
Records have multiple different actions they
	can be made, and each of those actions have
	their own timeouts.

	These timeouts allow you to notify the user if
	an error has occured due to connection issues
	and gives you granular events to allow
	different reactions to different situations.

	The timeouts are:

	ACK_TIMEOUT
		If the user does not recieve a timeout when
		initially requesting a record or discarding
		it.

	RESPONSE_TIMEOUT
		If the user does not recieve the data in a
		timely fashion.

	DELETE_TIMEOUT
		This is when the backend does not respond
		when a record is deleted.

	CACHE_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT
	STORAGE_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT
		This is a specific backend issue and does
		not need to be exposed to the user, but
		helps with logging issues.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client creates a record named "happyRecord"
the client requires write acknowledgement on record "happyRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|CR|happyRecord+
the server sends the message R|A|S|happyRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|happyRecord|100|{"name":"John", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffles", "type":"dog","age":2}]}+
the client record "happyRecord" data is {"name":"John", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffles", "type":"dog","age":2}]}
the client sets the record "happyRecord" "pets.0.name" to "Max"
the last message the server recieved is R|P|happyRecord|101|pets.0.name|SMax|{"writeSuccess":true}+
the server sends the message R|WA|happyRecord|[101]|L+
the client is notified that the record "happyRecord" was written without error
the client sets the record "happyRecord" "pets.0.name" to "Max"
the client is notified that the record "happyRecord" was written without error
the client sets the record "happyRecord" to {"newData":"someValue"}
the last message the server recieved is R|U|happyRecord|102|{"newData":"someValue"}|{"writeSuccess":true}+
the server sends the message R|WA|happyRecord|[102]|L+
the client is notified that the record "happyRecord" was written without error
the client record "happyRecord" data is {"newData":"someValue"}
the client sets the record "happyRecord" to {"validData":"newErrorData"}
the last message the server recieved is R|U|happyRecord|103|{"validData":"newErrorData"}|{"writeSuccess":true}+
the server sends the message R|WA|happyRecord|[103]|SError writing record to storage+
the client is notified that the record "happyRecord" was written with error "Error writing record to storage"
the client sets the record "happyRecord" "validData" to "differentData"
the last message the server recieved is R|P|happyRecord|104|validData|SdifferentData|{"writeSuccess":true}+
the server sends the message R|WA|happyRecord|[104]|SError writing record to cache+
the client is notified that the record "happyRecord" was written with error "Error writing record to cache"
the client sets the record "happyRecord" "validData" to "someData"
the last message the server recieved is R|P|happyRecord|105|validData|SsomeData|{"writeSuccess":true}+
the server sends the message R|E|VERSION_EXISTS|happyRecord|105|{"validData":"newErrorData"}|{"writeSuccess":true}+
the last message the server recieved is R|P|happyRecord|105|validData|SsomeData|{"writeSuccess":true}+
the server sends the message R|WA|happyRecord|[106]|L+
the client is notified that the record "happyRecord" was written without error
the connection to the server is lost
two seconds later
the client throws a "connectionError" error with message "Can't connect! Deepstream server unreachable on ws://localhost:7777/deepstream"
the clients connection state is "RECONNECTING"
the client sets the record "happyRecord" "pets.0.name" to "Max"
the client is notified that the record "happyRecord" was written with error "Connection error: error updating record as connection was closed"
the connection to the server is reestablished
the server sends the message C|A+
the clients connection state is "AUTHENTICATING"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the clients connection state is "OPEN"
the connection to the server is lost
two seconds later
the client throws a "connectionError" error with message "Can't connect! Deepstream server unreachable on ws://localhost:7777/deepstream"
the clients connection state is "RECONNECTING"
the client sets the record "happyRecord" "pets.0.name" to "Max"
the client is notified that the record "happyRecord" was written with error "Connection error: error updating record as connection was closed"
the connection to the server is reestablished
the server sends the message C|A+
the clients connection state is "AUTHENTICATING"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the clients connection state is "OPEN"

name: Record write acknowledgement
description:
Write acknowledgement when setting a record
	allows users to pass a callback to the set method
	of a record.

	It will be called with any errors while setting
	the record

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client creates a record named "happyRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|CR|happyRecord+
the server sends the message R|A|S|happyRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|happyRecord|100|{"name":"John", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffles", "type":"dog","age":2}]}+
the client record "happyRecord" data is {"name":"John", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffles", "type":"dog","age":2}]}
the server sends the message R|P|happyRecord|101|pets.0.age|N3+
the client record "happyRecord" data is {"name":"John", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffles", "type":"dog","age":3}]}
the server sends the message R|U|happyRecord|102|{"name":"Smith", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffus", "type":"dog","age":4}]}+
the client record "happyRecord" data is {"name":"Smith", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffus", "type":"dog","age":4}]}
the client sets the record "happyRecord" "pets.0.name" to "Max"
the last message the server recieved is R|P|happyRecord|103|pets.0.name|SMax+
the client sets the record "happyRecord" to {"name":"Smith","pets":[{"name":"Ruffus","type":"dog","age":5}]}
the last message the server recieved is R|U|happyRecord|104|{"name":"Smith","pets":[{"name":"Ruffus","type":"dog","age":5}]}+
the client discards the record named "happyRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|US|happyRecord+
the server sends the message R|A|US|happyRecord+
the client creates a record named "happyRecord"
the server sends the message R|A|S|happyRecord+
the server sends the message R|R|happyRecord|100|{"name":"John", "pets": [{"name":"Ruffles", "type":"dog","age":2}]}+
the client deletes the record named "happyRecord"
the last message the server recieved is R|D|happyRecord+
the server sends the message R|A|D|happyRecord+

name: Record
description:
Records are arbitrary JSON structures that can
	be manipulated and subscribed to. Every change
	to a record is synced accross all subscribed
	clients.

	The actions that can be performed on a record
	are:
	- Request a record to recieve the current
	state and subcribe
	- Send or Recieve updates to the record
	- Discard the record when no longer needed on
	the client
	- Delete the record if no longer needed in the
	system

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client provides a RPC called "toUppercase"
the last message the server recieved is P|S|toUppercase+
the server sends the message P|A|S|toUppercase+
the connection to the server is lost
two seconds later
the client throws a "connectionError" error with message "Can't connect! Deepstream server unreachable on ws://localhost:7777/deepstream"
the clients connection state is "RECONNECTING"
the connection to the server is reestablished
the server sends the message C|A+
the clients connection state is "AUTHENTICATING"
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the clients connection state is "OPEN"
the server received the message P|S|toUppercase+

name: RPC Connectivity
description: RPC providers must be resent to the server after connection issues to guarantee it continues to recieve requests correctly.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client provides a RPC called "toUppercase"
the last message the server recieved is P|S|toUppercase+
the server sends the message P|A|S|toUppercase+
the server sends the message P|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>|Sabc+
the last message the server recieved is P|A|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>+
the client recieves a request for a RPC called "toUppercase" with data "abc"
the client responds to the RPC "toUppercase" with data "ABC"
the last message the server recieved is P|RES|toUppercase|<UID>|SABC+
the server sends the message P|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>|Sabc+
the last message the server recieved is P|A|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>+
the client recieves a request for a RPC called "toUppercase" with data "abc"
the client responds to the RPC "toUppercase" with the error "An Error Occured"
the last message the server recieved is P|E|An Error Occured|toUppercase|<UID>+
the server sends the message P|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>|Sabc+
the last message the server recieved is P|A|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>+
the client recieves a request for a RPC called "toUppercase" with data "abc"
the client rejects the RPC "toUppercase"
the last message the server recieved is P|REJ|toUppercase|<UID>+
the server sends the message P|REQ|unSupported|<UID>|Sabc+
the last message the server recieved is P|REJ|unSupported|<UID>+
the client stops providing a RPC called "toUppercase"
the last message the server recieved is P|US|toUppercase+
the server sends the message P|A|US|toUppercase+

name: Providing RPC
description:
Remote Procedure Calls are deepstream's
	concept of request-response communication.
	This requires a client that makes the RPC
	(requestor or receiver) and another client
	that answers it (provider).

	The provider is responsible for notifying the
	server that it is capable of recieving
	requests with a certain name.

	These scenarios covers the provider, which is
	responsible for recieving RPC with a certain
	name, and either accepting to execute them by
	sending back an acknowledgment, or rejecting
	it so that another RPC provider can execute it
	instead.

	If the RPC provider does accept the request,
	it can either respond with a succesful
	callback and the result arguments, or with an
	error and associated error message.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client requests RPC "toUppercase" with data "abc"
the last message the server recieved is P|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>|Sabc+
the server sends the message P|A|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>+
the server sends the message P|RES|toUppercase|<UID>|SABC+
the client recieves a successful RPC callback for "toUppercase" with data "ABC"
the client requests RPC "toUppercase" with data "abc"
the last message the server recieved is P|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>|Sabc+
the server sends the message P|A|REQ|toUpperCase|<UID>+
the server sends the message P|E|RPC Error Message|toUppercase|<UID>+
the client recieves an error RPC callback for "toUppercase" with the message "RPC Error Message"

name: Requesting an RPC
description:
Remote Procedure Calls are deepstream's
	concept of request-response communication.
	This requires a client that makes the RPC
	(requestor or receiver) and another client
	that answers it (provider).

	The requestor can make an RPC call and in most
	cases expected a succesful callback.

	However, if something does go wrong, it should
	also expect an error message, which can either
	be system determined such as NO_RPC_PROVIDER
	or an error thrown by the provider itself,
	like when the incorrect arguments are sent.

steps.name: the test server is ready
the client is initialised
the server sends the message C|A+
the client logs in with username "XXX" and password "YYY"
the server sends the message A|A+
the client requests RPC "toUppercase" with data "abc"
the last message the server recieved is P|REQ|toUppercase|<UID>|Sabc+
some time passes
the client recieves an error RPC callback for "toUppercase" with the message "RESPONSE_TIMEOUT"
the client provides a RPC called "toUppercase"
the last message the server recieved is P|S|toUppercase+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for toUppercase"
the client stops providing a RPC called "toUppercase"
the last message the server recieved is P|US|toUppercase+
some time passes
the client throws a "ACK_TIMEOUT" error with message "No ACK message received in time for toUppercase"

name: RPC Timeouts
description:
Remote Procedure Calls are deepstream's
	concept of request-response communication.
	This requires a client that makes the RPC
	(requestor or receiver) and another client
	that answers it (provider).

	Whenever a provide or unprovide event does not
	recieve an acknolowdgement from the server the
	client should emit an ack timeout error so
	that the client can attempt to retry.
